reviews.review_msg: I THINK IT IS TIME TO RETIRE

Great professor! The class was actually SA443 - very discussion-based class, really interesting content and she taught it well. Completely open to student feedback and is there to help when needed. Would definitely take again!

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! NO KIDDING!! IF YOU CARE FOR YOUR SANITY AND PEACE, PLEASE AVOID HER! She does NOT teach!  Students do their own learning and when she "teaches" her explanations are terrible and incomprehensible! Her last name even says it ALL! Please please please avoid this lecturer and if unfortunately, you can't, well sorry and GOODLUCK!
She requires a lot of work with no help or clear direction Multiple assignments due a week with lots of readings.

Guidelines for assignments are vague.  Encourages discussion, but lectures can be dull nonetheless.  Avoid her if you don't need SA356.  Marking scheme for the course includes 4 fieldnote journals, 4 assignments based on those fieldnotes, attendance/participation, 3 methods summaries for the readings, and a Pechakucha presentation.
She is a horrible professor who is incredible ignorant. She ignores valid opinions made by her students and attempts to belittle them whenever possible. I strongly recommend avoiding her.

Pam is AMAZING! Super engaging and funny. Heavy course load (we're working on a collaborative research project as a class) but all of the assignments have been very useful and practical. Pam's so helpful and provides incredible feedback on all assignments. Favourite prof at SFU thus far. I highly recommend taking a class with Pam.
